Articles.Content:
On 3/11/2019 at 1:49 AM, MikeO89 said:

Holy crap dude! I can't even tell you how much you made my day. An avid FASA mod user since I discovered it. After 1.3.1 when the rcs thrusters started having this issue, I had to come to terms that this is just the way it might stay. Now you resurrected it to be in prime time again. I can once again use all FASA parts. Yeah! Thank you much.

Hi @MikeO89, did you manage to get the RCS working on the APS units with the MMH/NTO fuels or are you in Stock? 

@raidernick I managed to get the them working using hyperbolic's by editing Apollo_APS.cfg but then I guess that will break it if I want to use it in Stock. Do you know what needs to be edited to do it properly or is it more complicated than that? I wanted to edit something in the the RO folder to keep FASA in tact but couldn't find what needed changing so maybe the RO config is missing altogether.

Thanks for maintaining this mod btw. Just getting back into KSP with RO/RSS which I never used before and FASA really makes it awesome and a great learning experience for the Apollo era.

Edit. On further investigation it seems to me (I'm not a programmer by any stretch though so take this with a grain of salt) that the introduction  of "name = ModuleRCSFX" to fix thruster fx has broken the interaction with RO/RSS. I think this is the same for the Command Module Thrusters. Either that or I'm doing something wrong.

Edited March 29, 2019 by ecob81

On 3/28/2019 at 5:56 AM, dresoccer4 said:

haha there's no way i could build the rockets from scratch. there's so many parts you'd need an engineering degree. 

Thats the problem, ive tried and failed! So many parts (which are awesome) but no really guide on how to assemble them.
anyone knows  how to fix the issue with the lunar module where somehow i can't go on a EVA, it always says "hatch is obstructed,can't exit".

You have to click C to go inside and then click on the lever on the door to open the door. You also have to go back in to close the door when you are done.

Edited May 13, 2019 by MikeO89

The Gemini Lander engine also has the same issue that the previous RCS thruster and APS Flight Pack has before you fixed it. Hadn't tried that engine until now or I would have reported it back when. It's a cool little engine, hope if you have time Raidernick, that you might fix it also. Thanks

I noticed a whole bunch of issues with fasa in 1.6.1 and ro/Ross in general. This is almost always due to the rcs or thrust transform placements and scaling. Can you compile a list if all parts that are still broken in 1.6.1 or 1.7. I am fairly sure I fixed the rcs issues in the latest ro release.
As far as I can see  all RCS thrusters and APS Flight pack were fixed at last update. The only one I can still see acting funny now is the little Gemini Lander Engine.

3 hours ago, MikeO89 said:

As far as I can see  all RCS thrusters and APS Flight pack were fixed at last update. The only one I can still see acting funny now is the little Gemini Lander Engine.

it works in rss/ro, what's wrong with it in stock?
This is without the RO mod.

6 hours ago, MikeO89 said:

This is without the RO mod.

Nothing out of the ordinary there. Since that engine was never actually built for all you know it could have warped reality like that when it fired.
Ok. A warped reality engine. Never expected that I guess.

[snip]

good mod

Edited June 4, 2019 by Gargamel
No Need to quote the ENTIRE OP, we know where it is.

Thanks for the work of all people involved in keeping this mod alive, i'm having a lot of fun with it replaying historic space missions.

One tiny problem though, the Gemini capsule PAW doesn't have a fuel cell option.

Spoiler

 

 

Do i have to change the default fuel setup, or is this a bug?

KSP 1.6.1,

RSS 16.2

RO 12.7. 1

FASA 7.2.5

 

eta1:

with just FASA, RPM and modulemanager installed, the fuel cell option is there.

So i guess RO ate it somehow, any idea how i could bring it back?

 

eta2:

Here is the RO cfg file for FASA Gemini pod, according to this i need Liquid Hydrogen and Liquid Oxygen to produce electricity, but i think i have plenty of both.

Looks like RO is supposed to add it's own fuel cell to the pod, but for some reason it doesn't.

Log

 

eta3:

Turns out the RO Gemini config changes the fuel cell to "TacGenericConverter", which comes from TAC Life Support mod.

After installing TACLS, the fuel cell option does show up on the Gemini Adapter Equipment Section. So i guess this is a RO problem, since they don't specify TACLS as a dependency, only a recommendation.

 

Edited July 11, 2019 by Buflak

.

Edited July 17, 2019 by Barzon Kerman

im lovin it 

-NcMonadls

Edited July 17, 2019 by Barzon Kerman

Hey kerbonauts, I've got a little problem. I don't kow if it's a bug or if I'm doing something wrong. I hope this is the right thread to post my problem.

I build an Apollo 11 / Saturn V "like" rocket thingy and everything works fine so far - with one exception: After separating the CSM from the S IVB, turning and docking with the LEM, I can't pull the LEM off the LEM attachment plate. The LEM is just stuck on the attachment plate. The decoupling function seems not do work/do anything.

I am using

  • Current KSP (Steam) with both official DLC
  • FASA 7.2.5
  • MechJeb
  • Hullcam VDS

Spoilers contains vessel download-link.

Spoiler

Craft file on Kerbal X

I would be very grateful if somebody could maybe take a look at the ship and help me with troubleshooting.

Edited July 30, 2019 by Laird
edited Vessel link again

6 minutes ago, Laird said:

Spoilers contain vessel data and download-link.

Hey Laird, Huge Walls of Text, even in spoilers, can cause issues for some users on some platforms, so we ask you host your large files on outside servers and link them here, which you did with the Kerbal X.  :D.  If there is something specific within the craft file you need to bring to our attention, then pasting in a small section of it would be fine.  Good luck with your issue.

Just now, Gargamel said:

Hey Laird, Huge Walls of Text, even in spoilers, can cause issues for some users on some platforms, so we ask you host your large files on outside servers and link them here

Oh, I'm sorry. Thanks for the advice, I'll keep that in mind.

On 7/28/2019 at 5:56 AM, Laird said:

Hey kerbonatus, I've got a little problem. I don't kow if it's a bug or if I'm doing something wrong. I hope this is the right thread to post my problem.

I build an Apollo 11 / Saturn V "like" rocket thingy and everything works fine so far - with one exception: After separating the CSM from the S IVB, turning and docking with the LEM, I can't pull the LEM off the LEM attachment plate. The LEM is just stuck on the attachment plate. The decoupling function seems not do work/do anything.

 

I solved the problem by myself. Still now sure if I missed something with the inital problem - I just solved it by adding a "Big G" Decoupler with almost no force set which i stage after CSM/LEM coupling. This separates the LEM from the SIVB correctly.

For those who are interested in the vessel anyways, I updated the craft file on KerbalX. The vessel is now fully operational. Including abort action group.

Edited July 30, 2019 by Laird
edited Vessel link again

I need help with the ALSEP parts. I'm doing a RO lunar landing and found earlier in this thread that the ALSEP parts should be put in the alsep box, but I can't find that part for the LM anywhere. Am I missing something?

I’m playing on a 1.3.1. installation with Realism Overhaul, RP-1, fasa, kas, principia.

Edited August 10, 2019 by Haukifile

I post it only on threads where it belongs and not on all mods your answer applies.
